business.headline: High-return FD offers in 2025: SBI, IDBI, Indian Bank, and moreEnhance your savings in 2025 with FD schemes offering up to 8.05% interest, valid until March 31, 2025.

Supreme Court gives big relief for online gaming sector. Details hereThe Supreme Court has stayed Rs 1.12 lakh crore GST notices against online gaming firms, with a final hearing scheduled for March 18, 2025.

Industry leaders call for up to 90-hour workweek. Are they willing to pay more? L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan made waves by suggesting employees should work on Sundays. Last year, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy proposed that millennials work 70-hour weeks to improve India's productivity.
Budget 2025: Don't expect these tax changesBudget 2025 is likely to prioritise fiscal discipline, minor tax tweaks, and cautious consumption boosts over bold reforms.

Rupee hits all-time low, nears 86 mark against US dollarRupee hits all-time: Closing at 85.9650, the rupee marked its tenth consecutive weekly loss, slipping 0.2% this week amid a strong dollar and persistent capital outflows.
Sensex, Nifty close lower amid earnings concerns; TCS gains 6% The S&P BSE Sensex lost 241.30 points to end at 77,378.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 95 points to end at 23,431.50.

Explained: Why IRCTC share price jumped up to 5% todayIRCTC share price: The stock rose nearly 5% to hit a day's high of Rs 800.65 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), compared to the previous close of Rs 763.50.
Blinkit launches Bistro app for 10-minute food deliveryBlinkit's Bistro delivers canteen-style food in 10 minutes, rivalling Swiggy's Snacc and Zepto Cafe.

Paytm sees strong institutional growth: Mutual fund stake surges by 3.3%, total holdings up 4%Paytm's progress toward achieving EBITDA before ESOP breakeven by Q4 FY2025 further reinforces its strong fundamentals and appeal to institutional investors.

Budget 2025: Looking back at tax relief measures for senior citizens in 2024Senior citizens seek tax relief and reforms in Budget 2025 to tackle inflation, income challenges and enhance their qulity of life.
GST return filing delayed. Deadline extension expectedGST return filing faces delays due to GSTN portal glitches, with a potential deadline extension expected to ease compliance challenges.

L&T chairman earned 534.57 times median salary of peers in FY24. Check detailsLarsen & Toubro (L&T) Chairman SN Subrahmanyan's remarks on the 90-hour workweek have been a topic of debate. Amid all this, his salary for FY24 has attracted eyeballs, which is 534.57 times the median salary of peers.
How to link and use your credit card for UPI transactions. A simple guideUPI integration with credit cards simplifies payments offering instant, secure, and contactless transactions.

Sensex, Nifty in volatile territory: What should stock market investors do? Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty rebounded on IT gains, but volatility persists amid FII outflows and global uncertainty. Here's what's driving the market and how investors should tackle it.

Budget 2025: What is joint taxation for married couples?The ICAI's Budget 2025 proposal for joint taxation of married couples aims to ease financial stress, boost compliance, and modernise India's tax system with higher exemptions and flexible slabs.

Tata Elxsi share price down 8%. Why did it hit 52-week low after Q3 results?Tata Elxsi stock price: At 10:40 a.m., Tata Elxsi's share price was down 7% at Rs 5992.95. In early trade, the stock hit a 52-week low of Rs 5,924.

TCS, Infosys, HCLTech rise up to 4%. Why IT stocks are rising today?All the sectoral indices were in red but the IT sectoral index stood tall amid the bearish sentiment in the market and was the reason behind Sensex and Nifty opening higher today.
Sensex tumbles 500 points again. Why is the stock market down today?Sensex and Nifty tumbled in early trade amid rising volatility despite strong IT gains. What's pulling the markets down further?

Explained: Why Adani Wilmar share price fell over 9% today Adani Wilmar share price: The stock has been under pressure recently, falling nearly 10% over the past five trading sessions and losing 12.28% over the last six months.

Capital Infra Trust Invit IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check status Investors who applied for the Ventive Hospitality IPO can check the allotment status via the BSE and Kfin Technologies Limited website.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Trump spared jail or fine at hush money case sentencing, days before taking officeTen days before taking office, US President-elect Donald Trump will not go to jail or pay any fine over his criminal conviction stemming from hush money paid to porn star Stormy Daniels in 2016.

Gandhi never wore a cap, but...: PM Modi invokes Mahatma in debut podcastIn a podcast with Zerodha founder Nikhil Kamath, Prime Minister Narendra Modi discussed the qualities necessary for success in politics--better communication, dedication, staying connected with people, among others.

Chhattisgarh Aaj Tak journalist's family hacked to death over property disputeAaj Tak district reporter Santosh Kumar Toppo lost three members of his family after dispute over property turned violent in Chhattisgarh.

When 24 Akbar Road shut its doors to ex-PM Narasimha Rao's hearseWhen former Prime Minister PV Narasimha Rao died in 2004, his family members were persuaded against their will to conduct his funeral outside Delhi. Not only that, but Rao's hearse was also denied entry to the party headquarters at 24 Akbar Road, reportedly on the orders of then Congress president Sonia Gandhi.
The male attitude towards sex toys is changing in IndiaHesitation, social taboo, judgment, and the shame associated with using sex toys often prevents men from exploring sex toys.

It's not Waqf Board but board of land mafias: Yogi Adityanath's big warningYogi Adityanath's stinging remark, at an AajTak event, came days after a cleric claimed that the Maha Kumbh in Prayagraj was being held on waqf land.

Industry leaders call for up to 90-hour workweek. Are they willing to pay more? L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan made waves by suggesting employees should work on Sundays. Last year, Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy proposed that millennials work 70-hour weeks to improve India's productivity.

K Annamalai backs R Ashwin on Hindi remark: A language of convenienceR Ashwin said Hindi wasn't the national language during a recent event at a private college in Chennai. Tamil Nadu BJP leader K Annamalai backed the cricketer's remark.

Ad or threat? Pakistan airline's Eiffel Tower advert has Twin Towers shadowPeople were left gawking and with questions as a Pakistan International Airport (PIA) advertisement showed its plane nosediving into the Eiffel Tower in Paris. People were reminded of a PIA ad from the 1970s with a plane casting its shadow on the Twin Towers. The towers were destroyed in the 9/11 terror attacks.

What is PM's skin regimen? Nithin Kamath's question that his brother failed to ask"I had a question that @nikhilkamathcio failed to ask: What is PM @narendramodi's skin regimen?" Nithin Kamath said in his post.

Give California to Canada: Trudeau opens up on his counter-offer to TrumpTrudeau told MSNBC that he had jokingly suggested to Trump that he could exchange a few places for Vermont or California in return.

Shiromani Akali Dal accepts Sukhbir Singh Badal's resignation as party chiefSukhbir Singh Badal had stepped down from the position in November last year after being declared 'tankhaiya' (guilty of religious misconduct) by the Akal Takht.

Anushka Sharma-Virat Kohli meet Premanand Maharaj, actor seeks 'devotion of love'Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli recently visited saint Premanand Govind Sharan Ji Maharaj. A video of their interaction with him has gone viral on social media.

Vanangaan review: Director Bala's film on sexual violence has contrasting ideologiesReleased-Fri Jan 10, 2025Vanangaan movie review: Director Bala's Vanangaan, starring Arun Vijay, Roshini Prakash and Ridha, is a film where the hero takes justice into his hands. The film is yet another addition to movies insensitively portraying sexual crimes against women.

Mauritian PM avoided Ganga dip due to filth: Yogi Adityanath's dig at OppositionYogi Adityanath, speaking at AajTak's Dharma Sansad event, claimed that the Mauritian PM avoided taking a dip in the Ganga after seeing the filth in the area when he visited the Kumbh in 2013.

Teen, out on morning run, hit by speeding Jaguar car in Greater NoidaThe victim's father filed a complaint at the Bisrakh police station, saying that the car was being driven recklessly and at high speed, leading to the accident.

The Hiuen Tsang link to Xi's Gujarat visit: PM Modi reveals in first podcastPrime Minister Narendra Modi revealed that Chinese President Xi Jinping wanted to visit Gujarat's Vadnagar in a 2014 phone call, citing Chinese scholar Hiuen Tsang's connection with the ancestral villages of both leaders.

Unveiling the secrets of Naga Sadhus, the spiritual icons of the Maha KumbhThe Naga Sadhus are members of various akharas. At the Kumbh, they inevitably become the centre of attention with their distinctive appearance and rituals.

Karnataka government may hike beer prices: Third round, but at what cost?Karnataka's beer prices might go up again, adding to the burden on alcohol consumers after multiple hikes in the last year. Industry concerns grow about economic impact, tax revenue, and consumer habits.

'Sorry, I'm not a good daughter': Law student, 20, dies by suicide in LucknowThe student was a second-year BA LLB student from Mathura. According to police, her body was discovered in her hostel room at Amity University's Lucknow campus.

OnePlus 13R review: Great hardware, loaded with features, and a killer priceOnePlus is back with two top-end phones — the OnePlus 13 and the OnePlus 13R. Of the two, we find in this review that the OnePlus 13R may prove to be a fan-favourite due to its combination of great hardware, ample top-end features and a killer price of just Rs 42,999.
Animal painkiller nimesulide banned over toxicity threat to vulturesIndia has banned the animal painkiller nimesulide due to studies confirming toxic effects on endangered vultures.

Game Changer review: Ram Charan excels, Shankar settles for mediocrityReleased-Fri Jan 10, 2025Game Changer movie review: Director Shankar's Game Changer, starring Ram Charan, Kiara Advani and SJ Suryah, is a handbook on electoral politics. The film looks spectacular, but the story is mediocre at its best.
Team from Zoological Survey of India discovers new pangolin speciesThe species is primarily found in Arunachal Pradesh and Assam, with potential ranges extending into Nepal, Bhutan, and Myanmar.

Upasana Konidela expresses admiration for husband Ram Charan's role in Game ChangerUpasana Konidela couldn't hold back her admiration for her husband, Ram Charan's performance in the film Game Changer. The Telugu cinema star's role has been appreciated widely, and Upasana is among his biggest fans.

Aaman Devgan on working with uncle Ajay: He rarely complimentsAaman Devgan spoke to India Today Digital about the challenges and learning experiences of working with his uncle Ajay Devgn in his debut film Azaad.

Aamir Khan reacts to 'awkward question' on love advice from JunaidAamir Khan attended the trailer launch of the film Loveyapa, which stars his son Junaid Khan in the lead role alongside Khushi Kapoor. When asked if he takes love advice from Junaid, he was momentarily tongue-tied. He then called it an "awkward question" and mentioned that he is currently "in no mood for love."

How Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai positioned Hrithik Roshan as a superstarHrithik Roshan's debut in Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai marked the beginning of a new era in Bollywood, positioning him as a superstar. The film's success was unexpected, but Hrithik's charm and talent captured the audience's attention from the start.

sports.headline: Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim comments on Rashford, Mainoo futuresManchester United boss Ruben Amorim has revealed that both Marcus Rashford and Kobbie Mainoo have a future with the club. Rashford and Mainoo have been reportedly linked with moves away from United.

Pratika Rawal reveals psychology studies' role in her match-winning knockPratika Rawal credited her psychology studies for shaping her mental resilience, helping her score a match-winning 89 against Ireland. Her partnership with Tejal Hasnbis guided India to a six-wicket win, securing a 1-0 series lead in Rajkot.

Watch: Virat Kohli arrives in Mumbai alongside Anushka Sharma and kidsVirat Kohli and Anushka Sharma, along with their children, returned to Mumbai after a spiritual visit to Vrindavan. Kohli's arrival at Kalina airport captured attention, as he waved to fans before shifting focus to the upcoming ICC Champions Trophy.

Malaysia Open: Satwik-Chirag overcomes stern test to reach semi-finalsIndia's Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty earned a hard-fought win to progress to the semi-finals of the Malaysia Open 2025 on Friday, January 10. Satwik-Chirag defeated Malaysia's Yew Sin Ong and Ee Yi Teo in straight games.

Newcastle's Alexander Isak wins Premier League December Player of the monthAlexander Isak's stellar form in December earned him the Premier League Player of the Month award, with eight goals in six matches. His performances have revitalised Newcastle United's attack, positioning the club as a serious contender for top-four spot.

Tamil Nadu beat Gujarat to win U-19 Cooch Behar Trophy 2024-25Tamil Nadu's solid all-round performance secures them the U-19 Cooch Behar Trophy 2024-25 title. Despite a draw in the final, their first-innings lead proved decisive, with key contributions from the bat and ball guiding them to victory.

FA Cup: Liverpool boss Arne Slot wary of 'hyped up' Accrington StanleyLiverpool boss Arne Slot has sent a warning to his side ahead of their 3rd round clash in the FA Cup against Accrington Stanley. Slot claimed that the lower league side will be 'hyped up' and looking to create an upset at the expense of the Redsw.

Here to sabotage Djokovic: Murray's hilarious Australian Open plansAndy Murray jokingly claimed his true motive for coaching Novak Djokovic ahead of the Australian Open is to sabotage Djokovic's Grand Slam success, transforming a fierce rivalry into a unique coaching alliance that's captivating tennis fans worldwide.

Consistent Pratika leads India to a comfortable 6-wicket win vs IrelandPratika Rawal's composed 89 and Tejal Hasabnis' unbeaten 53 powered India Women to a comfortable 6-wicket win over Ireland in the first ODI. Gaby Lewis' valiant 92 went in vain as India took a 1-0 series lead.

Watch: David Warner hilariously hits himself after bat breaks during BBL clashIn a hilarious incident, David Warner hit himself on the head after the Sydney Thunder captain's bat broke during the clash against Hobart Hurricanes on Friday, January 10. Warner scored 88 runs during the match.

Imagine if Messi coached Ronaldo: Medvedev on Djokovic-Murray team-upAndy Murray's unexpected role as Novak Djokovic's coach mirrors a Messi-Ronaldo partnership, turning fierce rivalry into strategic collaboration ahead of the Australian Open, marking a bold new chapter in tennis history.

Gutted: Ashley Young reacts to failing to complete historic moment with son TylerAshley Young claimed that he felt gutted after he was unable to complete the historic moment with his son Tyler in the FA Cup on January 9. Young and Tyler had the chance to become the first father-son duo to play against each other in the FA Cup.

Former India pacer Varun Aaron retires from all forms of cricketVarun Aaron, known for his fiery pace and resilience through countless injuries, bids farewell to cricket. From 150kph thunderbolts to an IPL title with Gujarat Titans, his journey epitomised grit and passion for the game he deeply loves.

Australian Open 2025: How much money will the champion win?The 2025 Australian Open is set to offer a record-breaking prize pool, with champions in both the men's and women's singles set to receive unprecedented amounts of prize money. The total prize fund for this year's tournament, the first Grand Slam of the year, has been increased by 11.56% to reach a staggering A$96.5 million.

How Axar, Jadeja influenced Cooper Connolly call-up for AustraliaStand-in captain Steve Smith has revealed that he pressed selectors to give a call-up to 21-year-old Cooper Connolly. Smith said that the decision was influenced by India using Ravindra Jadeja and Axar Patel together in their Test team.

Expect the unexpected: Real Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti on Super Cup ClasicoReal Madrid boss Carlo Ancelotti has warned the fans to expect the unexpected when they face Barcelona in the Spanish Super Cup final on Sunday, January 12. Madrid defeated Mallorca in the semi-final to set up the clash.

Inzamam, Misbah, Mushtaq and Anwar inducted into Pakistan Cricket's Hall of FameInzamam-ul-Haq, Misbah-ul-Haq, Mushtaq Mohammad and Saeed Anwar were inducted into the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Hall of Fame.

Saim Ayub out for extended period, Champions Trophy participation doubtfulPakistan opener Saim Ayub's participation in the Champions Trophy is uncertain after being warned by a physician in London that his ankle ailment could take longer than six weeks to recover.

Who is Sayali Satghare? All-rounder makes India debut vs IrelandSayali Satghare made her international debut as India faced Ireland in Rajkot. The seam-bowling all-rounder, a standout domestic performer, promises to bolster India's lineup as they prepare for crucial matches leading up to the 2025 ODI World Cup.

Swiatek considered revealing her doping case while awaiting outcomeIga Swiatek described her doping ban as the worst time in her life and revealed she had considered publicly disclosing her positive test for the banned substance trimetazidine but chose to wait until authorities resolved the case.

Watch: Virat, Anushka visit Vrindavan after India returnIndia batter Virat Kohli and actor Anushka Sharma visited Vrindavan to meet Shri Premanand Govind Sharan Ji Maharaj. Kohli will now get ready for the ICC Champions Trophy in February after the Australia series.

Sam Konstas might miss out on opening spot in Sri Lanka, hints George BaileyAustralia chief selector George Bailey has hinted that Sam Konstas might not open in Sri Lanka. Konstas, who stole eyeballs in the recently concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy might be shifted down the order, or might have to wait outside of the playing XI.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
